PeteyPakJan 31 at 12:06 PM
Wrong format for this story

This isn't an app, it's a pre-rendered video. And if you move your head the world sways around you. And if you tilt your head you get serious eye strain and motion sickness. Real nausea that you thought you were completely immune to as a VR user.

And the story is designed for very young children or toddlers, and there are good arguments to say that children that young shouldn't be dissociating what they see from the rest of their senses, so VR seems an odd choice for this particular story.

So:

*Quality of animation*: Great, sure. It would make a fine TV episode. I see my two year old neice enjoying things like this a lot. I skipped through bits but liked the glowing balloons.

*Appropriateness of the concept*: Poor. If it's for VR, need to aim at children at least grade-school age or higher (or with the pedigree of the makers involved, aim higher still!).

*Experience of watching this format of thing in a Quest*: Very poor. Some adaptation or innovation is needed to make this work. It is not comfortable.
